loans.name: Yomo Spers Group

texts.en:
The Yomo Spers Group is made up of six women who live in the Teshie community. They chose trading because they could not pursue higher education, and they have not regretted having chosen the trading profession. They sell sandals, vegetables, “Wakye” (a dish composed primarily of cooked rice and beans), underwear, cutlery and palm fruit. 

Mary is 59 years old, married to a 72-year-old pensioner, and they have four children. The children are all grown and are taking care of themselves. Mary sells ladies' footwear. She works to take care of her husband, who is a sick person and has retired from active work. This is her fourth loan cycle, and she needs the amount of 1,100 GHS, to be able to buy more sandals for resale.

Together, the Yomo Spers Group women need a total amount of 2,850 GHS to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more footwear for resale to customers.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 47-year-old, married woman, and the mother of five children, from San Miguel, Bohol. She is currently engaged in a food vending business, selling cooked food to the people in the community.

Felicitas needs additional capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients, like flour, sugarcane and butter. With this new investment, she will be able to cook more snack food to sell.

In the future, Felicitas wants to expand her business, and to explore another business venture, to augment her income. She will use the income to continually support the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients, like flour, sugarcane and butter.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a 34-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest child is twelve, and the youngest is eleven months old. She has had a sari sari (variety/general) store business for twelve years.  She sells items like rice, noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks to the people in her community. She usually earns about six thousand pesos a  month with her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy more items to sell, such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, noodles, and sugar. In the future, Thelma hopes to expand her business into a big grocery store and to be able to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, canned goods,shampoo, noodles, and sugar to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en: Roseminda is 22 years old, married and has two children, ages 1 and 3. She is from Bien Unido,Bohol. She is engaged in the fish-vending business and  has been selling fish for five years. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase a new boat and fishing materials like a fish net. Her husband is a fisherman. Roseminda would like to expand her business to support her family as well as to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn has run a sari-sari or variety store business in San Miguel, Bohol for more than five years. She sells goods like biscuits, bread, noodles, canned goods, soap, shampoo, rice and soda.
Evelyn is requesting for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as soda, canned goods, soap and snack foods.
Through this loan, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers, thus increasing her sales and income.
In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her store and make it more sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her three children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as soda, canned goods, soap and snack foods.

loans.name: Robesana

texts.en: Robesana is 41 years old, married and has four children. She hails from Bien Unido,Bohol. The oldest child is 20 while the youngest is 4. She has a sari-sari (variety store) business selling items like biscuits, canned goods, sugar, toiletries and sugar. She  usually earns about 6,000 PHP per month through her business. Her husband is a fisherman. She is requesting a loan of 30,000  PHP to buy more items to sell such as rice, gasoline and fishing nets. In the future,  Robesana hopes to expand her business so she would be able to establish a big grocery store. She also hopes to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy rice, gasoline and fishing nets.

loans.name: Cranaa Group

texts.en:
Bernice is a 40-year-old woman married to Emmanuel, who works in a metal workshop. Bernice sells jeans of all kinds. She is a member of a group called "Cranaa" and they are into the trading of the following items: jeans top and down, fish, pepper, maize, and plastic products. They are five in number. They need a total sum of 1,950 Ghana cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

This is their third loan with ID-Ghana. Bernice said, "We formed our group because we all need working capital to invest in our businesses. And after working with ID-Ghana, we trust Kiva’s support so that our businesses would flourish. We have gone round assessing several financial institutions, but the one which convinced us is ID-Ghana because their conditions are flexible as compared to others. This informed our decision to work with this organization." 

Bernice’s previous loan amount was 350 Ghana cedis, which is invested into the business. She works every day from Monday to Saturday to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and has been making 100 Ghana cedis per month as profit. She has been doing this job for seven years and hawks from door to door. 

She now needs an amount of 500 Ghana cedis to buy more jeans to sell.

loans.use: to buy jeans and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Annonciatha

texts.en: Annonciatha is 49 years old and married with nine children, ranging in age from 7 to 27 years old.  Her husband works as a mechanic and she sells food items.  With this loan, she wants to buy beans and sorghum for sale.  The profits from this will be used to reinvest.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Damascene

texts.en: Damascene is 27 years old and single.  He sells animals and has been in the business for four years.  He wants the loan in order to buy cattle and goats for resale.  The profits from this business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and goats for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy staple products (20 liters of vegetable oil, boxes of soap, sugar etc)

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is a mother of eight children. She is a businesswoman and has been in the business for five years. With the loan, she will buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
She is married and has five children, and she lives in a three-room house in Bamenda, a part of Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenge she has faced was being sick in the hospital for months, with no money to pay hospital bills or purchase drugs in the pharmacy. During that time she also lost her mother and father, so nobody was there to care for her in the hospital. 

This lady joined GHAPE in the year 2012 and has managed, and successfully repaid, one loan. With the new loan requested, she will rent a piece land for farming, buy farming seedlings like maize, beans, yams, and cassava, plus fertilizer. She will buy good improved seedlings for her farming so as to have good yields. Also she intends to keep chicks, when they are six weeks she resells them. With this farming business activity, the community will have a regular supply of farm products like maize, beans and yams, at moderate prices.

She holds a positive view on this business to succeed, because she sells good food, and the entire locality knows her for that, because she sells at a very moderate price, and because her business environment is also neat thus encouraging people to buy from her. 

With the profit from the loan, she will work with her husband to educate the children, to cater for family needs, and to build a more comfortable house. She prefers a loan from GHAPE  because  of its low interest rate and convenient repayment intervals, and because members are educated on loan and business management before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land and buy chicks.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 8.  She sells sorghum and beans.  With this loan, she wants to add more tones of sorghum and beans.  With the profits, she will buy a cow to provide milk for the family.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum and beans for sale.

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson Antonio de  31 anos de edad, soltero padre de dos hijos de 3,5 anos de edad. El originario de Malpaisillo, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona norte del  país. Malpaisillo se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial agrícola muy productiva. La actividad en la que se desempeña Nelson es la venta de artesanías, desde hace seis anos. La cual consiste en viaja al país vecino de Costa Rica y ofrece la artesanía elaborada en nuestro país como ollas de barro, alcancillas, pulseras, jugos de cocina de barro, jarrones, floreros. Los problemas y desafíos en dicha actividad son los impuestos en la frontera los cuales cobran muy alto. El negocio lo aprendió de sus padres que por tradición ha sido un negocio familiar. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra y venta de artesanía variada. Nelson Antonio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Nelson Antonio, 31, is a single father of two children, ages 3 and 5.  He is from Malpaisillo which is in the northern part of the country and known as a very productive agricultural and commercial area.  Nelson sells crafts for a living and has been in business for six years.  He travels to Costa Rica where he sells Nicaraguan crafts such as clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay cookware jars and vases.  The challenges he faces are the high duty tariffs charged at the border.  

He learned the trade from his parents who ran the business before him.  He is in need of a loan to buy and sell the different craft articles.  Nelson Antonio is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping low income earners in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: To buy crafts such as clay pots, piggy banks, bracelets, clay cookware, jars and vases.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is 46-years-old and has two young children ages 16 and 7.  Her husband is also a farmer. Vilma grows rice and other crops in their field.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm.  In the future, Vilma dreams of improving her farming business so that it will produce a good yielding of crops thus increasing her profits.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Nareth's Group

texts.en:
Nareth is 18 years old and married. She and her family live in a rural village of Kandal Stoeng district, located in Kandal province in Cambodia. She is blessed with a lovely dependent daughter. To make a living, Nareth has been working as a rice farmer for three years, earning around 28,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 8,000 KHR, after offsetting her daily cost of living.

Nareth, a first-time borrower, is leading a group member, who also is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner), to apply for a loan in the amount of 160,000 KHR each. 

In order to create a healthy environment for her beloved daughter as well as her whole family, Nareth is planning to use her loan portion to construct an appropriate latrine for her family. Via the help of this requested loan portion, Nareth hopes that she and her family can completely avoid unsanitary practices and successfully promote sanitation and hygiene practices in Cambodia.

loans.use: To construct an appropriate latrine

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa is a married woman and has four children. The oldest child is eighteen while the youngest is ten. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for fifteen years. She earns two thousand pesos a month by doing this farming. She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings. In the future, Rufa hopes that her business will be successful and to be able to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She is a vegetable vender and has been selling vegetables for twenty five years. She is a very hardworking and ambitious lady. She has built a house for her family and thanks Faulu Kenya for the financial support they have given her. She also practices farming to earn a living.  She hopes to own a grocery store and have a stable business. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to increase her stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en: Francine is 27 years old. She is married with two children, who are ages 3 and 8. She owns a general store where she sells different items. She has had this business for four years. She wants the loan to buy more cooking oil, maize flour, and beans to sell in her store. She has decided to put all the profits towards her savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, maize flour and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 25 years old. She is now a new married woman to a businessman. She sells used shoes and has been in the business for more than a period of four years. She would like to get the loan for add more shoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Olivier

texts.en: Olivier is 32 years old. He sells spare auto parts. He has been in the business of selling foodstuff for the past couple years, but now he would like to divert his business to dealing with spare auto parts. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare auto parts to sell in his business. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con junto a su esposo y a su hijo en su casa propia,  cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque. En toda la zona los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Carmen cuenta con dos negocios en su domicilio: El primero es la venta de chicha de jora (bebida típica hecha a base de maíz)y cervezas y adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta animales menores, cuenta con experiencia de más de seis años en ambas actividades. Ambas actividades le sirven para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como jornalero en los campos de cultivo de la zona

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales y alimento balanceado, de modo que pueda responder a la demanda que suele incrementarse en fiestas navideñas. Para ello ha solicitado un crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que le permitan lograr su objetivo. Adicionalmente desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, como compra de materiales para ampliarlo.

Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Kiva y Edpyme Alternativa y le ha ido bastante bien, por ello se encuentra muy agradecida, y gracias a la grata experiencia que pasó, ha decidido recurrir nuevamente a la buena voluntad de los prestamistas de Kiva, a los cuales agradece de antemano su ayuda.
texts.en:
Carmen, 32, lives with her husband and son in their own house which has electricity and running water.  It is located in the rural area of the department of Lambayeque, which is an agricultural, live-stock farming, tourism area.

Carmen runs two business from her home: the first is selling a corn-based drink known as "chicha de jora" and beer.  She also raises and sells small animals and has been in both business for over six years.  Her work allows her to help her husband cover household expenses.  Her husband is a wage earner and works on farms in the area.

Carmen wants to expand her business by buying more animals and balanced animal feed so she can respond to the increase in demand over the Christmas holidays.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 4,000 PEN to meet her goal.  She also wants to carry out some home improvements and will buy materials to do so.

She has worked with Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa before and is very grateful.  Thanks to her positive experience she has decided to resort to the good will of Kiva lenders once again, and thanks them in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy animals and feed to expand her business, and to buy materials for home improvement.

loans.name: Magalis

texts.es: Magalis con su previo credikiva obtuvo más ganancias y dio a conocer mucho más sus productos, porque compró en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos y produjo mas adornos llegando a muchos más clientes. En la actualidad invertirá su nuevo financiamiento en nuevas compras de materiales como Maicena, vaselina pegamento entre otros. Con ello elaborará suvenires para  primera comunión, Matrimonios, grados y para cumpleaños, exigidos por la temporada que se avecina y en la que usualmente las familias realizan sus fiestas. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias por el apoyo brindado el cual fue de mucha ayuda.”
texts.en: Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, Magalis earned higher profits and made her products better known. She was able to do so by purchasing raw materials and supplies in bulk, which enabled her to produce more ornamentation, reaching many more clients. She will invest her new loan to purchase more materials such as cornstarch, vaseline, glue and other supplies. With these products, she will create souvenirs for first communions, weddings, graduations and birthdays; such products are in demand during the upcoming holiday season during which families usually throw their parties. Her  message to Kiva lenders is as follows : "thank you so much for the help you gave me which helped me a lot".

loans.use: to purchase items such as cornstarch, vaseline, glue and other supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, a 28-year-old married mother of three, has been selling vegetables for five years. She is very hopeful that things will become stable and she will eventually be in a position to provide for her family adequately.

Having learnt how to manage her business through the help and support of Faulu Kenya, Judith dreams of having a big business. She is now requesting a loan of 21,363.75 KES to increase her vegetable stock.

loans.use: to increase her vegetable stock.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from San Miguel, Bohol. Josefa has been engaged in the rice farming business for more than ten years now. Her husband also works as a farmer.  Josefa works hard to support her husband in tilling their farm.

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this, they will be able to produce good quality crops, thus increasing their yield and income from the farm.  In the future, Josefa dreams of improving their livelihood and to experience fullness of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 55-year-old financial trainee who has provided financial services for the past twelve years. He is married and has five children.  James also earns another income by providing day care services. He is very hardworking and willing to learn and Faulu Kenya has helped him become financially stable.

He plans on expanding his business and become successful in life. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to purchase a laptop.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop

loans.name: Mutiifu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est une jeune femme, trésorière du groupement d’affaire Tumusifu, entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans et mère de 4 enfants qui vont a l’école. Cette cliente vit sans mari. Elle est sociétaire d’un petit restaurant de faubourg. Elle commença cette entreprise avec le crédit de Hekima, cela, vers les années 2009. Elle vient de réaliser 16 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 sacs de haricots, 30 kg de pommes de terre, 25 litres d’huile, du sel, 1 sac de braises, etc.   Dans le futur, la cliente rêve acheter une parcelle pour ses enfants. Dit-elle dans l’ancien temps, elle était sous logée par un membre de sa famille. Alors, actuellement, elle se paye maintenant le loyer. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien sans cesse aux petits entrepreneurs femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Kabuo is a young single woman aged 36, and the treasurer of the business group Tumusifu. She is an entrepreneur and the mother of four children who attend school. She is the owner of a small restaurant in a local suburb. She began her business in 2009 with the help of a loan from Hekima.

Kabuo has just completed 16 cycles in the micro loan program. Her current loan will be used to buy two sacks of beans, 30 kg of potatoes, 25 liters of oil, salt, and one sack of coal, among other supplies. It is Kabuo's dream to someday be able to purchase a plot of land for her children. Kabuo has said that she was previously able to live with a family member, but that she now pays for rent expenses. She is thankful to Hekima for the support it provides to women entrepreneurs who would otherwise not be able to start their own small businesses.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her restaurant, including two sacks of beans, 30 kg of potatoes, 25 liters of oil, salt, and one sack of coal.

loans.name: Mario Genaro

texts.es: Mario Genaro de 52 anos de edad, casado con tres hijos de 22, 18,7 anos, él es originario de León, lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del país. Mario Genaro tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de ganado, actividad que el inicio hace 12 anos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante. Él viaja unas 3 veces por semana a las comarcas aledañas ofreciendo el ganado a clientes fijos y eventuales. Mario Genaro ha demostrado ser un hombre responsable, trabajador. En los créditos anteriores el demostró su puntualidad en los pagos. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en  capital de trabajo  y comprar  un ganado que le están ofreciendo  a buen precio. Mario Genaro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mario Genaro is 52 years old, and is married with three children, aged 22, 18, and 7. He is a native of León, located in the western part of the country. 

He makes a living by raising and selling livestock, which he started doing 12 years ago. He makes his sales as a street vendor. He travels about 3 times a week to surrounding regions, offering livestock to new and regular customers. 

Mario Genaro has proven to be a responsible, hard-working man. With his previous loans he demonstrated punctuality in his payments. 

He needs funding to invest in working capital and buy a herd of cattle that is being offered at a good price. 

Mario Genaro appreciates the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua, to make a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy a herd of cattle at a good price

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe Soutoura ont  en moyenne 35 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan  dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe décident  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire, 
Madame,   BABA LASSINA  (2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite) excelle dans la vente de datou. Elle est très sollicitée au marché de Mopti où elle effectue ses ventes surtout les jours de foire et où beaucoup de ses clients viennent des  environnants. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  500 kg de dah qu’elle transforme en "datou"(une sorte de cube maggi locale).  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail  à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, elle  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen
 de 7.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider
son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four women who compose the Soutoura group are mostly married in extended traditional families.  On average, they are 35 years old and have five children each.  They all live in a village called Niazekan, located in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, commerce and kinship, and they buy and sell condiments.

In order to meet the needs of an increasingly numerous and demanding group of customers, the members of the group have decided to join the micro-loan program offered by Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan.

Baba Lassina, second from the left in the photo, is a very experienced "datou" seller. [Datou is a fermented condiment made from dah, a species of hibiscus].  Her goods are in high demand at the Mopti market.  On market days especially, she sells to many customers who come from surrounding areas.

She is planning to use her loan to buy 500 kg of dah which she will processes into "datou". 

She sells for cash to a retail customer base consisting of men and women.

Baba Lassina is expecting average monthly profits from this loan to reach 7,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy some "dah" (or Roselle, a species of Hibiscus)

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 62 years old, married, and has six children. He is a horticultural farmer and has been farming for the past 14 years. He also earns an income from livestock farming and is very ambitious and hardworking. He hopes to grow a tremendous amount of flowers and expand his business. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase fertilizers and chemicals for his flowers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and chemicals for the flowers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 55 years old, married, and has three children. She owns a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits to earn a living. Faulu Kenya has helped her start saving and also expand her business. She hopes to expand her business more and be a major vegetable supplier. She requests a loan of 50,000 KES to buy vegetables and fruits for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Candy Nattalli

texts.es: La Sra. Candy tiene 28 años soltera  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tucumanas que son empanadas fritas con jigote ella tiene su puesto de venta que se encuentra en una zona concurrida de la ciudad de la Paz este préstamo es su quinta  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Candy va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos por mayor como harina y aceite por mayor  para la elaboración de sus tucumanas, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, ya que su  clientela esta incrementado y ya tiene pedidos por mayor, la Sra. Candy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia que esta frente a frente y en cada esquina, ella va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir abasteciendo a su clientela, realizando la producción en mayor cantidad, su deseo con el tiempo es a cambiarse a un ambiente amplio.
texts.en: Candy, 28, is single and works making and selling ‘tucumanas’ which are fried turnovers filled with minced meat.  She has her stand in a very busy part of the city of La Paz and this loan is her fifth sequence in the institution.  Candy will use the loan to buy ingredients like flour and oil at wholesale to make turnovers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is the lack of working capital because her clientele has increased and she has wholesale orders to fill.  The business challenge Candy faces is competition on every corner and across from her.  She will use profits to continue supplying her customers and producing in larger amounts.  Her wish for the future is to move into a more spacious environment.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make turnovers.

loans.name: Yereta N°2 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les six femmes du groupe Yereta N°2 ont  en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le village de Niazekan dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de condiments de tous genres, de céréales, de savons et biens d'autres articles divers. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur  1 er  prêt solidaire,
Madame,  Chata Solo  (1 ère femme debout sur la photo en foulard rouge) excelle dans la vente de savons. Elle est très sollicitée dans son activité. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de savons (kabakourouni) et 2 sacs de savons (Barika Tigui) et  s’approvisionne à Koutiala.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Chata Solo espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 17500 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married mostly in traditional extended families, the 6 women of the Yereta N°2 group are on average 41 years old and have 5 children. They live in the village of Niazekan in the region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali) and know each other through neighborhood ties, professional activities, and kinship. They practice in the buying and selling of all kinds of condiments, cereals, soaps and various other goods. 

With the goal of satisfying the needs of their customers, who are more and more numerous and demanding, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. This is the first group loan.

Chata Solo (the first woman standing in the photo with the red scarf) excels in the selling of soap. She is very sought after in the business. She hopes to use her loan to buy 2 bags of kabakourouni soap (a locally made soap) and 2 bags of Barika Tigui soap. She procures her goods in Koutiala. She makes her sales in cash or credit, retailing to customers who are men and women. 

With this loan, Chata Solo hopes to make an average monthly profit of 175,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and help her husband take care of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 42 years old, married, and has one child. He is a tailor and works very hard, so that he can support his family. His lifestyle has changed since he joined Faulu Kenya and he learned how to save.

He hopes to have an established business and to expand his business to a large tailoring business. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles élargies, les quatre femmes du groupe ont  en moyenne 43 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Lafiabougou de la ville de San, dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de leurs activités professionnelles et de parenté. Elles font l’achat et la vente de légumes, d’habits de poissons et de la restauration. 
Dans le but de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles de plus en plus nombreuses et exigeantes, les membres du groupe ont décidé  d’intégrer  le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur onzième  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les dix précédents.
Madame,    Maïmouna   présidente de l’association (2 eme debout  avec un mouchoir sur la tête) excelle la vente de bazin riche et wax. Elle est très sollicitée dans le quartier et au grand marché. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 50 pièces de wax ,4 pièces de bazin riches  à Bamako.  Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle mixtes. 
Avec ce prêt, Madame Maïmouna espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 46000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et  aider son conjoint dans la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four group members are married women living for the most part in extended traditional families. They average 43 years of age and six children each. They all live in the district of Lafiabougou in the city of San, region of Segou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know one another as neighbors and colleagues, and through ties of kinship. They buy and sell clothing, vegetables, and fish, and they provide restaurant services. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of a growing and demanding customer base, and are now seeking their 11th group loan. The past ten loans were correctly repaid.

Mrs. Maïmouna is the group’s president. She is the one standing second from the left with a scarf on her head). She is an expert at selling rich bazin fabric (a type of damask) and wax pagnes (colorful west-African cloth). She is in high demand in the neighborhood and at the big market. 

She will use her loan to buy 50 pieces of wax pagnes and 4 pieces of rich bazin in Bamako. She sells at retail to a mixt clientele, for cash and on credit. 

With this loan, Mrs. Maïmouna expects to earn an average monthly profit of 46,000FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity and to help her spouse with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy rich bazins and wax pagnes for resale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 58 years old and married to Rogelio. They live in the San Juan province of Isabela. She is a very loving parent and does everything to make her family members' lives better. That's why Rosita manages a store — to provide additional income for the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy spices, noodles and beverages for her store. She wishes that someday she can see her children have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy spices, noodles and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase grains (rice and beans) and a variety of items to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 58 años, comparte una relación conyugal con Darío de 60 años con quien tiene la alegría de tener 4 hijos, creciendo en un ambiente de amor y trabajo, comparten sus vivencias en una casa de adobe adquirida desde que llego a fundar su localidad. Tuvo una larga trayectoria en el campo agrícola, pero con el pasar de los años noto que el cansancio y la fatiga se presentaban  de manera constante, es asi que invirtió el dinero ahorrado en todo este tiempo, en una tienda, instalada en el primer ambiente de su casa. viene desempeñándose en este negocio desde hace 4 meses, logrando acumular poco a poco ganancias, y es debido, que negocio como el de ella ahy pocos en su comunidad. De acuerdo a la manera en como ha ido trabjando, debe abastecer constantemente su negocio al punto de cumplir con las expectativas de su clientela. Ahora último tiene mucha demanda de panetones y conservas, es por ello que desea reabastecer su negocio con más variedad de dichos productos para así aprovechar la demanda.
las ganancias que obtiene son para sus hijos, ya que su principal prioridad es el ofrecerles una buena educación, pues considera que “No hay mejor inversión que la educación ”. Cuenta con siete créditos mostrando puntualidad en sus pagos, espera seguir perteneciendo a MFP por un periodo prolongado ya que es una buena alternativa, le agrada mucho la manera en como se encuentra organizado su banco comunal, resaltando la buena conducta crediticia que presentan sus compañeros en su conjunto. 
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de panetones, conservas y otros productos al por mayor para mantener su negocio bien abastecido constantemente.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 58, is a very hardworking woman.  She’s shares a conjugal relationship with Darío, 60, with whom she shares the joy of having four children growing in an environment of love and work.  They share their lives in an adobe house they acquired when they settled in their location.  She’s had a long career working in the agricultural fields but as time passed and she noticed that fatigue and exhaustion were her constant companions, she invested her life’s savings in this business, a grocery store that she set up at home.  She’s been in business four months gradually earning profits because there are few businesses like hers in the community.  Because of the way she’s been operating, she has to stock up constantly in order to meet customer expectations.  What are in high demand now are panettones and canned goods so she wants to restock her store with more variety of said products to meet demand.

Profits she earns are for her children since her main priority is providing them with a good education since she believes that “There is no better investment than education.”  She’s had seven loans and has been punctual with her payments.  She hopes to continue being part of MFP for a long period of time because it’s a good alternative.  She likes the way her communal bank is organized very much especially the good way her fellow members behave with their loans.  She will use the 3,000 new soles to buy Panettones, canned goods and other products at wholesale to keep her store constantly stocked.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and Panettones.

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en:
Jenniffer is a 34-year-old tailor who has been in business for four years. She is married and has three children.  Jeniffer previously practiced farming to earn a living. Through Faulu Kenya's help she has been able to be more focused on her business. 

She dreams of having a large tailoring business and to increase her business profits. She requests a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabric for her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of three school-age children from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business for more than eight years now, since her husband is a fisherman. 

Gloria works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. 

Gloria is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, buckets, lead weights, and fuel for the fishing boat. Through this, her husband will be able to increase his daily catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  In the future, Gloria dreams of expanding their venture and make it a lucrative business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, buckets, lead weights and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
La socia Nieves teiene 50 años de edad,es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos,ella vende los zapatos por medio de catalogos y ofrece a sus amigos,la socia trabaja en forma independiente desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos.La socia solicita le credito para comprar zapatos.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en: Nieves, 50, has a spouse and two children. She sells shoes to her friends via catalogue.  She works independently from 8am until 5pm. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the shoes.    She’s asking for the loan to buy shoes.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de tripas de cordero ,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia apoya a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de carme (tripas de cordero)para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuoatas establecidas.
texts.en: She belongs to the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) communal bank and continues selling lamb tripe.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She’s a responsible, enterprising person who supports her family this way.  She’s requesting a loan to buy meat (lamb tripe) for her business.  She is grateful for the loan granted and commits to make her scheduled installment payments.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen es una joven que desea obtener su primer credito. Tiene mas de seis años de trabajar con ganado de leche. Los lácteos es una de sus pasiones es por eso que él desea un préstamo de trecientos mil colones (300.000) para la compra de una vaca lechera, con la que podrá empezar su proyecto lechero.
Ella desea obtener mejores ingresos asi como ser una pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman who wants to obtain her first loan. She has worked with dairy cattle for more than six years. Dairy products are one of her passions, and this is why she wants a loan of 300,000 colones to buy a milk cow, with which she will be able to begin her dairy project.

She wants to obtain better income as well as be a small business person.

loans.use: to buy a cow for dairy production

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is a 56-year-old, married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She is the mother of two adult children. She is engaged in farming and has been growing rice for thirty years. She earns five thousand pesos a month by doing the farming. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, to purchase fertilizers and pesticides to use, so the rice can grow healthy in order to have a good harvest. Narcisa would like invest in another business in the future, to support her family and at the same time to have a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 26 years old and she used her previous loan to buy potatoes, cooking fat, tomato sauce, and salt. Her business did very well and she was able to repay her loan.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money and also manage her business properly. She also practices farming and is very hardworking. She will use 32,298 KES to buy potatoes, cabbage, and tomatoes for her food stall.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, cabbage, and tomatoes for her food stall

loans.name: Kanini

texts.en:
Kanini is 69 years old, married with five children. She earns a living by selling vegetables in her grocery shop. She also farms. She is very hardworking and responsible, and she has been in the business for 20 years. 

She wishes to grow to greater heights through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. She requires a loan of 10,936.69 KES to increase the stock of tomatoes, kale, spinach and cabbages.

loans.use: to increase stock of tomatoes, kale, spinach and cabbages to resell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old, married with three children. She is a business woman operating a mobile phone money transaction business (m-pesa), and has been in business for the past five years. She is a very hardworking lady and her first loan from Faulu Kenya helped her improve her business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya.

She wishes to open another mobile phone money transaction business. She requests a loan of 50,000 KES to add money for doing transactions in her business.

loans.use: to add money for doing transactions in her mobile phone money business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 43 years old, married, and has four children. He is a poultry farmer, who sells eggs and chicks and has been farming for two years. He was previously involved in selling clothes, and he is very hard-working. He has learned how to save his money since he became a member of Faulu Kenya. He wishes to own several vans (matatus) in the near future. He requests a loan of 106,600 KES to buy feed and add more poultry to the flock.

loans.use: to buy feed and add more poultry

loans.name: Gabina

texts.en:
Gabina is a 62-year-old married woman and a mother of five grown-up children from San Miguel, Bohol. She runs a convenience store selling various goods to the people in the community.

Gabina is asking for a loan to buy additional stock of products to sell in her store, such as soap, shampoo, soda, and canned goods.

Gabina hopes to expand her business in the future so that it will continue to generate more income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of products to sell in her store, such as soap, shampoo, soda, and canned goods.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She is a poultry farmer and has been in the poultry farming business for seven years.  She sells chicks to earn a living and also relies on her husband’s income. She is very hardworking and friendly, and thanks to Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money and make new friends.  She dreams of supplying more chicks to her customers in the future. She requests a loan of 21,363 KES to buy chicks and chick mash (food for chicks).

loans.use: to buy chicks and chick mash

loans.name: Llesh

texts.en:
Llesh a 47-year-old married man and father of four children from northern Albania.  His children range in ages: the oldest is 18 years old and the youngest is eight. Llesh himself comes from an extremely poor family and has lived under such conditions since he was born. To top it off, his family was persecuted as well, and that added to his suffering as a child until about ten years ago when the Area Development Program of World Vision Albania extended their help to him and his family.

Llesh has experience in the livestock activity, because that’s “what I practiced since I was very young and knowing nothing better, I love what I currently do,” he said looking down. “If my parents didn’t have plans for me because they simply couldn’t, I have for my children. I want to educate them all, in order for them to have a decent life different from mine,” he continued saying. Llesh is in immediate need of a loan to build a good sized stable, so that all the goats sleep warmer at nights.

loans.use: To build a good-sized stable for the goats

loans.name: Zabina

texts.en:
Sabina is a married woman. She has 4 children, ages 6 to 25 years. She describes herself to be humble, caring, and determined. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a potential business area, and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for buying the stock.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes to resell. Her business goal is to run a bigger retail shop within 5 years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma es concubina (no está casada) y tiene un hijo varón que está en etapa de lactancia, vive en la casa de su mama donde cuenta con un ambiente donde se encuentra el dormitorio  la cocina, y el baño la  habitación es de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona 16 de julio de El Alto, donde se realizan ferias en la ciudad del Alto.
Actualmente se dedica a la compra y venta de peluches pequeños, medianos y grandes; su puesto se encuentra sobre la vereda siendo el lugar lleno de polvo ya que se encuentra actualmente en refacción, ella trabaja los días jueves y domingo días que son ferias en esta zona de 16 de julio. Su pareja también ayuda en la compra de los fardos de ropa  ya que son muy pesados y ambos colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta.
El crédito lo requiere para agarrar mercadería (más peluches y también un par de fardos de ropa), ya que desean tener y surtir su mercadería y así mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Dña Norma es poder obtener su tienda y así tener mejor ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Norma is in a common-law relationship and has one child who is currently nursing. She lives at her mother’s house where she has a space with a bedroom, kitchen, and bathroom. The space is made of adobe and has dirt floors. The house is located in the July 16th District of El Alto, a city where many fairs are held.

Norma currently buys and sells plush toys that are small, medium, and large in size. Her vending stall is located on a sidewalk that is covered in dust since it is undergoing repairs. Norma works Thursdays and Sundays at the fairs in the July 16th District. Her partner helps out by purchasing bundles of clothing since they are very heavy. Both of them help one another with their expenses, such as basic services, food, and clothing.

The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire merchandise (more plush toys and two bundles of clothing) so that she can restock her inventory and improve her earnings. Doña Norma wants to acquire a storefront so that she can generate more revenue and improve her quality of life.

This is the first time she has requested a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy plush toys and two bundles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a welder, who deals with the manufacture of doors and windows. He has been in this business for three years. He is very focused on his job, because that is where he earns a living. He has become financially stable and has learned how to manage his business properly.

He wishes to own a hardware shop and be able to support his family of four. He requests a loan of 50,000 KES to buy metal.

loans.use: to buy metal

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 50 years old and a widow. She has five children. She used her previous loan to start a poultry business, by buying and raising chicks. She was able to pay her loan because her business did well.

She hopes to buy a piece of land where she can rear many cows. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Iliana, tiene 28 años, casada con Frank, y juntos tienen a Franklin, su pequeño hijo de 9 años. Ella a su corta edad ha logrado con ayuda de su pareja lograr construir su vivienda con material noble como muestra de que a futuro es capaz de cumplir muchos retos.
Muy unida a Frank, quien se desempeña como músico y artista, rescataron la idea de adquirir equipos de sonido con el objetivo de alquilarlo en fiestas sociales, patronales y demás eventos hallando un gran mercado de constante trabajo. Dicho negocio se inicio hace 9 años con un dinero que sus padres le prestaron y poco a poco fueron implementando con la compra de mas consolas de sonido logrando así consolidarse en el rubro.
Una de las cosas que ella rescata es que el trabajo por lo general se desarrolla los fines de semana dándoles a los dos un tiempo para compartir juntos a su pequeño los días particulares de la semana, no obstante los factores que complican su trabajo son las lluvias que se presentan pues eso malograría sus equipos.
Por otro lado, la demanda constante de sus equipos, hace que no pueda cumplir con todos lo eventos y eso genera perdida de oportunidades para ganar más dinero. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de comprar equipos de sonido y así aprovechar todas las oportunidades de trabajo que se vienen para esta época del año.
 Tiene consigo 15 créditos con el cual muestra su profundo agradecimiento por la constante confianza que MFP le brinda, Da su visto bueno total a su banco comunal ya que lo denomina como un grupo sólido.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles asignados complementará su capital de trabajo para la adquisición de más equipos de sonido para cumplir con todos los contratos posibles.
texts.en:
Iliana, 28, is married to Frank and they have a nine-year-old son, Franklin.  At her young age with help from her spouse she’s managed to build her house with substantial materials as proof that she can reach many future goals.  Very united to Frank who works as an artist and musician, they came up with the idea of acquiring sound equipment to lease for social events and town patron saint festivals and others; they discovered a great market and constant work.  They started the business nine years ago with some money their parents lent them and they gradually equipped it with the purchase of more sound consoles thus becoming established in the line of work.

One of the plusses of the work is that it’s generally weekend work which gives both of them time to share their child together especially during the week.  However, among the work’s minuses is rain that occurs and can damage their equipment.   On the other hand, however, demand for their equipment is constant to such an extent that they are unable to respond to all the events which causes lost opportunities for earning more money.  This is why they need to buy more sound equipment to be able to take advantage of all the work opportunities that will be coming up this time of year.

She’s had 15 loans and she is profoundly grateful for the constant trust MFP has placed in her.  She’s totally in favor of her communal bank because she considers it to be a solid group.  She will use the assigned 3,000 new soles to add to her working capital to buy more sound equipment to be able to take on as many contracts as possible.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 3 years to 15 years. She describes herself as polite, humble, and a God fearing woman. She operates a tailoring business where she sells clothes . She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located at a potential business area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fabric to make clothes to sell. Her business goal is to run a retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
“Work hard to achieve the best,” is a quote lived by Josephine. She is engaged in a hog-raising business, an enterprise that she wants to expand through hard work, so that she can support the needs of her family, especially for the education of her children. She is 48 years old, and married to Romeo, a farmer, who also guides her in the hog-raising business. They have seven children.  

Josephine is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP that she will use to expand her business by purchasing additional hogs and feeds. She hopes and will strive hard to improve her business to meet the growing needs of her family, particularly since the prices of commodities are increasing.

loans.use: to purchase hogs and feed for business expansion.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia.
Con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Luis trabaja como en el rubro de la construcción, él es maestro de obras, antes trabaja como obrero en una pequeña parcela agrícola, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien los buenos acabados que les da a sus trabajos.
Luis se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de servicios higiénicos; de esta manera Luis tendrá su hogar mejores condiciones, más adecuados y seguros para su familia, así pues Luis seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr sus sueños y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 40, is a man living in the city of Pisco with his wife and children who he loves and are his main reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic person who along with his wife focus all their efforts into moving their family forward.

With much effort and dedication, Luis works in construction as a master builder.  He used to work as a day laborer on a small parcel of farmland.  He starts work very early in the morning because he works about 8 hours daily; he thinks he does well because of the good finishing touches he gives to his jobs.

Luis is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some improvements to his house.  He wants to plaster, paint and install toilet facilities so that his house will be in better condition and more adequate and safe for his family.  Luis will continue working towards reaching his dreams and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is a 61-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married to a fisherman and they have 5 grown children.

Rufa depends on their fishing business. She and her husband also catch crabs for an income. She is asking for a loan to buy crab traps, gasoline, and fishing nets. She knows that a loan will go a long way in her business. The income will pay for healthy food for herself and her husband. In the future, she hopes to have enough savings so that they can retire in comfort.

loans.use: to buy crab traps, gasoline, and fishing nets.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita is 52 years old and married. She has five children and lives with them and her husband in Isabela. Lolita and her husband earn money by running a grocery store from the door of their house. They started this business nine years ago. Lolita requires a loan to expand her business by purchasing many kinds of products, such as toothpaste, shampoo, spices, bread, and personal sanitary items to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She also hopes that this will enable her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, shampoo, spices, bread, and personal sanitary items to stock her store.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is engaged in planting and selling vegetables, which are mostly eggplants harvested from her own back yard. 

To improve her business, Rogelia would like to ask for financial support amounting to PHP 8,000. She will use the loan to buy different kinds of vegetables in the public market, which she will sell in their village. She only goes to the market twice or thrice a week, since she has limited access to transportation. 

Part of the loan will also be used to buy a variety of vegetable seeds, which she will plant in her back yard. Through her business, she can help her husband in meeting the needs of their family and somehow uplift their lives.

She is aware that she is getting old, and while she has the strength, she will do her best for their family. Her husband, Valeriano, is a farmer.  They both work as laborers for additional income when they are not busy with their own businesses. They have poor living conditions, and struggle to live a better way. 

They live in a mountainous village of Cabisera in Isabela province. Despite poverty, they manage to have a good relationship in the family and are all hoping to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Maria es originaria de Granada, actualmente vive en Estelí, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de su pulpería, su nivel académico es hasta segundo grado de primaria, ella empezó su negocio  con la ayuda de su esposo,  además de eso tenia otro negocio como es de vender tortilla, pero después decidió quitarlo porque miro que ese negocio de tortilla no le generaba mucho ingreso. Actualmente  se dedica al negocio de la pulpería.
Maria solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, huevo, jabón,  etc. Toda la mercadería necesaria para surtir su pulpería, el cual estima de gran ayuda, pues podrá  invertir en su negocio  en la compra de productos mas solicitado por sus clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar el área del negocio para mayor atracción de los clientes  con el objetivo de obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is originally from Granada, but currently lives in Estelí. She is a merchant by trade and manages a convenience store. Maria has a second grade education. She started her business with the help of her husband, but she also had another business in which she sold tortillas. However, she stopped selling tortillas because she was not generating much profit. She currently devotes herself full-time to her convenience store.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy more products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, soap, and other items. She needs all of these items to restock her store. Maria believes the loan will be a great help since she will be able to invest in products that are often requested by her customers.

Her future plans include expanding the size of her business so that she can attract more customers with the goal of obtaining a better income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, milk, eggs, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un padre de familia de 51 años de edad, conviviente y con 03 hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su familia. La casa está ubicada en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande. La zona en donde vive es considerada como rural y no cuenta con los servicios básicos.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de ganado vacuno, ovino, porcino y aves de corral; los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. También es agricultor, sembrando maíz dos veces por año. Cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en la ganadería y agricultura. Adicionalmente es peón estable en un fundo de mango, en donde le pagan mensualmente.

Carlos se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 2200 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir alimentos para mantener su ganado y comprar fertilizantes para su maíz. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva y le ha ido bastante bien, por ello se encuentra muy agradecido y, tomando en cuenta su grata experiencia, ha decido acudir nuevamente a los prestamistas de Kiva para que le ayuden a salir adelante. El agradece de antemano la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Carlos, 51, is a father living with his spouse and three children in his care.  He lives with his family in his own house located in one of the settlements that make up Tambogrande District.  The zone they live in is considered to be rural and does not have basic services.  His activity is raising cattle, sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl that he sells in the local market when they reach ideal size and weight.  He farms growing corn twice a year.  He has more than 15 years’ experience in agriculture and animal husbandry.  In addition, he’s also employed as a day laborer in a mango plantation and earns a monthly salary.

Carlos is requesting a 2,200 new sol loan to buy feed for his cattle and to buy fertilizer for the corn.  He’s worked with Kiva funds previously and has done very well; he’s very grateful for that and noting the pleasant experience he’s had has decided to call on Kiva lenders once again so that they’ll help him get ahead.  He gives thanks in advance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
El socio Jorge Luis pertence al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,el socio continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes,el socio cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos  a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,el socio lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante. 


El socio solicita el credito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Jorge Luis is a member of the “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together) communal bank and continues with his business raising small farm animals like guinea pigs.  He raises these little animals to sell later to customers that request them.  He’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it daily.  He’s a responsible, enterprising man who gets ahead this way.  He requests the loan to buy guinea pigs for his business.  He’s grateful for the granted loan and commits to make his installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el socio trabaja con mucho empeño y responssabilidad,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas.

El socio esta contento con el credito otorgado y se compromete a pagar las cuotas.
texts.en: He continues working in transportation.  He has a car he uses to provide taxi service in various streets in Cusco.  He works very hard and responsibly.  He’s been in business six years and does very well.  His dream is to own a new car.  He requests the loan to buy tires.  He’s happy with the granted loan and commits to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy tires

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is 30 years old, and sells milk to earn a living.  He has been running the business for four years. He also has a motorbike transport business to earn more income. Through Faulu Kenya he has improved his business, because he has been trained on business management skills.  Duncan hopes to grow his clientele in the future.  He needs a loan of 36,365 KES to buy a solar lamp. He will use the solar lamp to light his house.

loans.use: To buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap is 59 years old, widowed, and has five children.  She resides in a rural village of Kror Kor district located in Pursat province in Cambodia. Pheap earns a living by farming rice and selling cakes.  She earns about 11,000 KHR per day. After deducting her daily cost of living, she is able to save around 6,000 KHR. 

Pheap is requesting her fifth loan with VisionFund along with a group member for a total of 1,500,000 KHR. With her previous loans, Pheap was able to meet her family’s needs and make her businesses more secure. With her new loan for 1,000,000 KHR, Pheap will build a latrine as well as purchase ingredients such as eggs, flour, and rice. to support her cake-selling business. 

With her loan, Pheap will be able to smoothly run her cake-selling business. With the latrine properly installed, Pheap and her family will be able to avoid unsanitary practices and help promote sanitation and hygiene practices in Cambodia.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is a 27-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest child is ten while the youngest is two. She has a sari-sari (variety/general) store business. She sells items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, and powdered milk.  She usually earns five thousand pesos a month through sales of the sari-sari store. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and sugar. Lourdes would like to expand her business by investing in other products in order to support her family, as well as to save for her children's quality education in the future.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles, and sugar for her store.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 50 years old and resides with her family in the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan. She is married to a Barangay Councillor and they are blessed with five children. The couple helps each other send three of their children to school. Their two elder children already finished their schooling and now have their own source of income. According to Aurea, she wants to give a good future to all her children since she doesn’t want them to be like her and not pursue their schooling.

Aurea ventured into the hog raising business five years ago. She sells grown-up hogs to earn income. She hopes to further expand her business by raising more hogs. She seeks assistance from Kiva lenders, who will help her improve and maintain her piggery. Aurea is asking to borrow a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) as additional capital to buy feed and additional hogs to raise. This will help her in making her business progress.

loans.use: to buy feed and hogs.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Luchadoras”, está formado por  21  señoras muy activas y solidarias todas amigas y vecinas de barrio. Están ayudándose las unas a las otras y quieren poder seguir creciendo en el trabajo de cada una.
Claudelina es la presidenta de este grupo, es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y luchar por su familia. Se dedica a la venta de comida de todo tipo y así sale adelante. Claudelina solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de verduras, carnes, pollos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende.
Ellas desean seguir trabajando, y de esa forma dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Luchadoras” (Fighting Women) consists of 21 women who are active and supportive of one another. All of them are friends and neighbors from the same area. They help one another and want to continue growing each day in their work.

Claudelina is the president of this group. She is a person who has the drive to succeed and strive on behalf of her family. Claudelina sells food of all types and also delivers it. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies in order to continue preparing the dishes that she sells.

The members of this group want to continue working so that they can provide their families everything they need.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken, and other supplies.

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en:
Joan's group is comprised of five hardworking women. Joan is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, which is in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Joan has been working hard to manage her business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Joan generate greater profits. She will use the savings to look after the family. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to make larger profits. 

Joan is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for training in life-skills.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
At 64, Marilyn is active in managing her small business selling commercial feed in her village. She is married to Orlando, a farmer, and they have four children. They live a simple life in the mountainous village of Cabisea 27 Hacienda San Antonio.

Marilyn is requesting a loan amount of 12,000 PHP, which she intends to invest in her business. She is also planning to put up a small village store if she still has extra capital. However, her main priority at the moment is to utilize the loan to buy sacks of feed for her business and rice mill. She hopes to improve her business and to sustain their resources for the benefit of her children. She also hopes to continue to support her children's studies. She said that, in order to achieve this, they need to work harder.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed for her business and rice mill.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.en: Avelino is 58 years old and married to Constancia, his partner in his hog raising and farming business. They have seven children. As the head of the family, Avelino wants to provide a better way of living for his family. For him to do this, he would like to request a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase an additional hog and to buy sacks of fertilizer to support their farming needs so they will have a good yield this harvest season. He hopes that through his business he can support the needs of his family and provide the daily school expenses for his youngest child. Avelino considers their village a poor area because of its poor road conditions especially during the wet season when transportation is rare. He says that he must work hard for the welfare of his family in order to attain his ambition in life.

loans.use: To purchase an additional hog and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Agren

texts.en:
Agren is a married woman. She describes herself as polite and courteous. She operates a nursery school where she provides teaching to children. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located at a viable business area and her primary customers are from the neighborhood. She describes her biggest business challenge to be delays of school fee payments from the students' parents and guardians. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stationery for the students. Her business goal is to expand her school to a primary school running up to the eighth grade within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a successful woman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stationery for the students

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.en:
Ni Wayan specializes in crafting sterling silver jewelry with gold accents as well as gemstones. She would like to purchase more natural gemstones and sterling silver to continue production. 

Ni Wayan has been selling through Novica since 2011. This is her story:

"I was born into a family of gold artisans in Bali, the fourth of seven children. Our village is known as a center of gold ceremonial jewelry. All of us learn to craft jewelry from the time we are in school. In 2009, my parents were named 'The Master's Hands' for gold and silver jewelry by The Jakarta Post. They taught me to learn patiently, work hard and never give up to achieve good jewelry. I will be a good jewelry maker like my parents and my brother, and I will make them proud of me. My husband is also a silversmith and this is part of my happiness in life, making my life worthwhile. I hope you like my jewelry and feel its beauty.

"I would like to send my deepest thanks to all of you for this microcredit. With your support I will be able to buy silver and gems to increase my stock. I hope this can help my business grow more. Thanks much! I wish you all the best things, and may good fortune come to your lives."

Use the link below to view Ni Wayan's sterling silver and gold accent jewelry on the Novica site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8093

loans.use: to purchase of more natural gemstones and sterling silver to continue production

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta and her husband Cesar are both farmers. Violeta also sells root crops derived from their harvest. They are blessed with five children; however, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to send most of their children to school to pursue their studies.

Violeta is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to purchase farm inputs including a variety of seeds and fertilizer and to maintain her vegetable-vending and root crop business. She aspires to develop their businesses so they can meet the needs of their family, and hopes that their continuous earnings will continue to sustain their enterprises. As well, Violeta prays that their children will all have better lives compared to what they have at the moment.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and maintain her vegetable business.

loans.name: Terezi

texts.en:
Terezi is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as a disciplined woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at a viable market area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of vegetables and fruits. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy vegetables and fruits to sell. 

Her business goal is to run a wholesale grocery store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful businesswoman. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married, has five children, and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (sister).
